When I unrar there are no files in the audio folder. Is this normal?
 I usually have no problems with this but feel like I am missing a step - what do i do with the unrared files?
Many thanks

There are hardly if ever files in the audio folder. Once you've unrar'd the files you need too use and application like nero; open nero and select "DVD-Video" (the compilation type); then simply drag the files from the "video_ts" (that you urared) into the the "video_ts" folder in nero; then all you have left to do is to click the burn button (remember this is the dvd-release. so you need to have a dvd burner and a blank dvd to burn it)
Many thanks it worked great! Fantastic.

Ive been having problems with torrents like this one with part files, I assumed that you just unzip the first one...then what? I am using an extraction program called Extract now, any help would be greatly appreciated, thanks.
you should give a program called "winrar" a try, its very pop and works great.
"Audio files" are only present if the disc has DVD Audio content, this is a dvd movie so - only the Video folder should be used (but you need both folders on the disc).

So either:

 b) larger download - quicker unzip
as far as what to do when you download a DVD release... google it for now. I'm in the process of creating a "how to"
